translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Citakapūjaka

analyzed: citaka pūjaka tthera apadāna  ajitaḥ nāma nāmena
translated: The Elder Citakapūjaka’s Birth Story🔽“At that time I was a brahmin
named Ajita.
Desiring to make an offering,
I gathered various flowers.
Seeing the burning funeral pyre
of the one with a crest, the friend of the world,
I gathered those flowers
and scattered them on the funeral pyre.
In the past, twenty-eight eons ago,🔽I made an offering of flowers.
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

analyzed: sattavīse itas kappe  satta asum manuja adhipā
translated: Twenty-seven eons ago,🔽there were seven kings
named Supajjalita,
powerful world-rulers.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations,
the six supernormal knowledges were realized,
the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus the Elder Citakapūjaka recited these verses.
